meanings.definition: Having more threads or resembling a thread.
meanings.sent1: The new fabric was threadier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: The sweater felt threadier after multiple washes.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics left a threadier mess than expected.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was threadier than a spool of tangled yarn.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web looked even threadier under the morning dew.

meanings.definition: Tending to break into threads or fibers.
meanings.sent1: The delicate paper was threadier than the thicker cardstock.
meanings.sent2: The worn-out rope became threadier with each use.
meanings.sent3: The old mop was so threadier it seemed to cry 'no more spills!'
meanings.sent4: His patience was threadier than a frayed rope, ready to snap.
meanings.sent5: The fabric was so threadier, it tore at the slightest touch.

meanings.sent1: The intricate design looked even threadier up close.
meanings.sent2: The embroidery on the dress made it look threadier than plain fabric.
meanings.sent3: The spider's web was threadier than any knitting project.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were threadier than a tangled ball of yarn.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the threadier details of the tapestry.
